reviews.review: To start off for this review, the game itself can be buggy at times. However, if you're good at adapting to scenarios then I recommend trying this game. YES the community can be toxic, but that's legitimately everywhere. There is a wide selection of killers and survivors to choose from; making a good factor on how to find your play style. There are licensed killers like Michael Myers, Freddy, etc. However this game is still not Pay-to-Win, you can unlock non-licensed killers by earning to buy killers and survivors. (either 9000-9200 per.) It's best to just ignore the community and have fun.

This game is really really fun with headphones/earphones, to live the full experience you must hear the game.

Dead By Daylight is an extremely fun team game that offers you a great experience playing solo or with friends. Playing as a survivor feels immersive and their use of sounds/music keeps you 'on your toes' when completing objectives or avoiding the killer. The wide array of killers offers players a wide array of play strategies and styles in hunting down survivors which can keep the game fun. There's a clear learning curve to playing either side effectively, so it's best to play BOTH to learn what to look out for. 

Playing with friends in ranked matches requires playing as a survivor, so waiting for a killer to queue up can be a bottleneck to playing and cause longer wait times. It's still super fun, but you may find yourself chatting in discord for a while and making up stories as to why 4 random people decided to camp in a school that looks like it hasn't taught a student in decades and there's a dude with a road cone on his head and Cloud Strife's sword chasing you around... and who the hell invited Dwight anyway?! Screw that guy....

If you're playing solo and find a longer wait time as killer or survivor, try changing 'teams' and you'll probably start getting into matches quicker.   

Finally, a minor quibble, but the bloodpoint system is extremely annoying. It is the 'character progression' system that unlocks/upgrades abilities and items for use in gameplay. Getting up to level 20 is the minimum level to use 4 perks, and level 40 allows you to teach a character's unique abilities with other survivors. It is grindy and discourages players from experimenting with the 25 survivors and 23 killers currently available in the game. I have over 50 hours in the game with 3 survivors and 1 killer at level 40. I have played less than 4 other characters. If you're a completionist and you don't want to spend extra money unlocking these abilities in their marketplace, it's a long grind ahead of you. None of these perks are essential to having the full experience of the game, but once you start thinking strategically on builds, you'll be doing your research to find out which character's perks can be combined to give you the best edge for your play style. 

Good luck, Have fun, and beware of the basement!

This is a great niche game, the dynamic of chases and licensed killers makes it hella fun. However the bugs, total lack of developer care untill serious game breaking bugs occur and unfinished state of new killers severely affects the fun factor. This game is in its best state atm and with games like home sweet home :survive coming out competition is arriving in this niche genre and will alleviate the developer effort. So expect great quality of life improvements coming. If i'm wrong don't waste your time and money, there are better consumer friendly products out there, here developers could care less, lets hope for better times in the future.

The best way you can enjoy this game is by setting your expectations for win condition and content insanely low. The developers don't treat it as a competitive experience and more like it's a party game.

That said, one of my biggest issues is that it no longer feels like a horror game. In my opinion, games like Friday the 13th: The Game were more fun because they actually scared you. They weren't balanced, but I never felt frustrated or cheated when I was killed. Dead By Daylight used to have that fear factor, which it lost around the release of The Clown. Now it feels more like they're trying to cram as much representation and fun as they can into it, which I am all for, but really trivializes how much fun you can get out of this game, especially now with the release of this dating simulator.

The art team is magnificent. They have done an incredible job. The writing team is magnificent. They have done an incredible job. The balance team is doing awful. Here we are on YEAR 6 and finally getting just a sliver of the things we needed so long ago. The balance director himself told us that that we, the players, the people who actually play the game, don't "understand" how to use the worst killer in the game effectively. Seeing some of these changes really make me scratch my head; it makes me feel unheard and that the developers don't actually play their own game. Drug dealers don't take their own drugs. It also feels as though the developers have prioritized pushing out cosmetics and outfits more than they have good and balanced content or bug fixes. Pinhead didn't have a voice for MONTHS. On top of that, the developers have been infamously survivor-biased because in a 1v4 game, when you please the 4 crying babies, you please more people than just 1.

I've been playing this game ever since right before the Curtain Call chapter on PS4. I played at least once a week until right after the Blight, whereas I bought a PC and made a full conversion to it. PS4 cross progression is one of the only ways I'll play this game regularly again, as the grind is so awfully long I can't be bothered to spend the previous 2-3 years of playtime getting my stuff back. 

My honest, bare-bones review for Dead By Daylight can be summed up like this:
If you're looking for a horror game but don't actually like being scared, this is for you. If you're an extremely laid back and casual gamer, one who cares not to get a trophy or try your best to win, this is for you.

If you're somebody who likes to win the games you play, this is not for you. If you're somebody who likes to feel like the game was a fair and just match. this is not for you. If you like constantly being disappointed and confused by developer decisions that make no sense, this is for you.

In 2016 this game had a big future ahead of it considering it was not the hit title it is today. But now, seeing as the company has fallen greedy to the success, it no longer receives the love, care, and attention it received back then.

I must give a negative review in support of trying to get better developer attention and care, but it is by no means a terrible game. This is still probably the best multiplayer horror game money can buy. It is also by no means the worst overall game you can buy; definitely a Top 10-15. But if you want an experience that's more fun, more fair, more balanced, more cared for, you should probably go look elsewhere with that $20.

Gosto de como Dead by Daylight se destaca em meio ao seu gênero, já que é realmente um jogo divertido e viciante, que pode até causar medo no inicio da experiência. Ao longo do tempo, foi o único jogo nesse estilo que conseguiu se manter em pé por um período considerado. Muito disso se deve ao fato de executar suas mecânicas minimamente bem, pelo menos, em comparação com os outros jogos de sua espécie. Todavia, é preciso afirmar alguns defeitos que podem ser encontrados por toda a gameplay. A começar com algumas mecânicas falhas que são ótimas ideias, mas muito mal executadas por sua equipe de desenvolvedores, perks como o 'Dead Hard', que corriqueiramente não funcionam ao serem usados, ou a hitbox totalmente quebrada, que alcança o sobrevivente a 20 km de distancia do assassino, podem atrapalhar a experiência de qualquer jogador. Além disso, a falta de conteúdo é claramente aparente, apesar de Dead by Daylight possuir muitos perks, com funcionalidades diferentes, muitos assassinos, com habilidades diversificadas, e mapas, com táticas de jogos diferentes, como só há um modo de jogo, ao ser extremamente jogado pode cansar alguns jogadores.

Game is very fun.

As killer:
Don't take it too seriously
Game is balanced around survivors so rank 4-1 is a nightmare unless you're super good.
Survivors are notoriously toxic (even when you're not being a d***head killer)

As survivor:
Fun to play with a group
Really OP if everyone on your team is good
Solo experience is rough, but you can get pretty high rank if you practice looping/basic tactics

The main drawback on this game is the leveling system which requires you to own the character that has the perk you want; level that character up to 35/40/45 (maybe like 10 games) and then purchase that perk for it to be available on all survivors/killers.

This perk then has a chance of never showing up on anyone you're leveling, which makes that process frustrating.
__

The gameplay is fun, and you can win consistently if you get good at the mechanics, but the general "systems" of the game are archaic in terms of how a new player can access content that is near required to be competitive.

If you're trying to go for rank 1 killer/surv you better be prepared to shell out at least another $20 to get the perks that are "meta". OR become a God and the perks don't matter, the second is pretty hard though considering there are some people in this game with 5k+ hours total.
